item.title: Input-Output Tables & the Leontief Inverse in R - Part I.
item.description: Surahammars Ironworks/Surahammars JÃ¤rnbruk, Sweden, 1919. From Sweden’s Tekniska Museet photo collection. In input-output economics, the Leontief inverse (i.e. [I-A]^-1) is ubiquitous. Named after the father of input-output economics, Wassily Leontief, the matrix is a compact representation of the ripple effects in an economy where industries are interconnected. A lone matrix coefficient conveys all direct and indirect effects on output in one sector required by a unit of output from another sector.
